00062 typedef struct {
00063    char port[NAME_LENGTH];
00064    int baud;
00065    char parity;
00066    int data_bit;
00067    int stop_bit;
00068    int flow_control;
00069 } RS232_SETTINGS;
00070 
00071 #define RS232_SETTINGS_STR "\
00072 RS232 Port = STRING : [32] com1\n\
00073 Baud = INT : 9600\n\
00074 Parity = CHAR : N\n\
00075 Data Bit = INT : 8\n\
00076 Stop Bit = INT : 1\n\
00077 Flow control = INT : 0\n\
00078 "
00079 
00080 typedef struct {
00081    RS232_SETTINGS settings;
00082    int fd;                      /* device handle for RS232 device */
00083 } RS232_INFO;

00088 
00089 #include <stdio.h>
00090 #include <string.h>
00091 #include <conio.h>
00092 #include <bios.h>
00093 #include <dos.h>
00094 #include <stdlib.h>
00095 #include <sys\timeb.h>
00096 #include "rs232.h"
00097 
00098 #define XON  0x11
00099 #define XOFF 0x13
00100 #define RING_BUFF_LEN 2000          /**** adjust if necessary  ****/
00101 #define NUM_PORTS     2             /**** number of COMx ports ****/
00102 
00103 static void interrupt com1int();
00104 static void interrupt com2int();
00105 static void comint_handler(int port);
00106 static void rs232_exit(void);
00107 
00108 extern void (*error) (char *str);
00109 
00110 struct {
00111    unsigned int port_base;
00112    unsigned int vector;
00113    void interrupt(*new_intr) ();
00114    void interrupt(*old_intr) ();
00115    unsigned char initialized;
00116    char ring_buff[RING_BUFF_LEN];
00117    unsigned char com_error, com_mode;
00118    int volatile write_mark, read_mark, send_enable;
00119 } ccb[] = {
00120    {
00121    0x3F8, 0x0C, com1int}, {
00122    0x2F8, 0x0B, com2int}
00123 };
00124 
00125 /* ------------------------- rs232_open ----------------------------- */
00126 
00127 int rs232_open(char *port, int baud, char parity, int data_bit, int stop_bit,
00128                int flow_control)
00129 /*********************************************************************
00130 * Initialize serial port according to parameters. Install interrupt  *
00131 * handler and uninstall it on exit.                                  *
00132 * flow_control == 0: no handshake; 1: CTS/DSR; 2: XON/XOFF           *
00133 *********************************************************************/
00134 {
00135 #define CTS  0x10            /**** Bit masks for handshake lines ****/
00136 #define DSR  0x20
00137 #define RLSD 0x80
00138 
00139    int mode = 0;
00140 
00141    static int first_init = 1;
00142    int parity_mask[] = { 0x00, 0x08, 0x18 };
00143    int baud_list[] = { 110, 150, 300, 600, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600 };
00144    int i;
00145 
00146    for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00147       if (baud_list[i] == baud)
00148          break;
00149 
00150   /**** init com port ****/
00151    bioscom(0, i * 0x20 | parity_mask[parity] | (stop_bit - 1) * 4
00152            | (data_bit - 5), port[3] - '1');
00153 
00154   /**** initialize ring buffer ****/
00155    ccb[port].write_mark = 0;
00156    ccb[port].read_mark = 0;
00157    ccb[port].com_error = 0;
00158    ccb[port].com_mode = mode;
00159    ccb[port].send_enable = 1;
00160 
00161    if (ccb[port].initialized)
00162     /**** reset old vector ****/
00163       setvect(ccb[port].vector, (void interrupt(far *) ()) ccb[port].old_intr);
00164 
00165   /**** save old vector, set new vector ****/
00166    ccb[port].old_intr = (void interrupt(far *) ()) getvect(ccb[port].vector);
00167    setvect(ccb[port].vector, (void interrupt(far *) ()) ccb[port].new_intr);
00168 
00169    ccb[port].initialized = 1;
00170 
00171    if (first_init) {
00172       first_init = 0;
00173       atexit(rs232_exit);       /* call rs232_exit routine at exit of the program */
00174    }
00175 
00176    outportb(ccb[port].port_base + 1, 0x05);
00177    /* enable Data Available Interrupt and     */
00178    /* Recieve Line Status Interrupt           */
00179    outportb(ccb[port].port_base + 4, 0x0B);     /* 8250 Interrupt enable         */
00180 
00181    inportb(ccb[port].port_base);        /* reset running interrupts      */
00182    inportb(ccb[port].port_base + 5);
00183 
00184   /**** 8259 Interrupt Controller init ****/
00185    outportb(0x21, inportb(0x21) & ~(0x10 >> port));
00186    outportb(0x20, 0x20);        /* end of interrupt */
00187 
00188    return port;
00189 }
00190 
00191 /* --------------------------- rs232_exit --------------------------- */
00192 
00193 static void rs232_exit(void)
00194 {
00195    int i;
00196 
00197   /**** reset old vector ****/
00198    for (i = 0; i < NUM_PORTS; i++)
00199       if (ccb[i].initialized) {
00200       /**** disable interrupt controller ****/
00201          outportb(0x21, inportb(0x21) | (0x10 >> i));
00202 
00203       /**** 8250 interrupt disable ****/
00204          outportb(ccb[i].port_base + 4, 0);
00205          outportb(ccb[i].port_base + 1, 0);
00206 
00207       /**** reset old vector ****/
00208          setvect(ccb[i].vector, (void interrupt(far *) ()) ccb[i].old_intr);
00209       }
00210 }
00211 
00212 /* --------------------------- send char -------------------------- */
00213 
00214 void rs232_putc(int port, char c)
00215 /*********************************************************************
00216 * Send a single character over the previously opened COM port        *
00217 *********************************************************************/
00218 {
00219    char str[30];
00220    int retry;
00221 
00222 #define TIMEOUT 3    /**** 3 seconds ****/
00223 
00224    port--;
00225 
00226   /**** wait until 8250 has sent previous character ****/
00227    while ((inportb(ccb[port].port_base + 5) & 0x60) == 0);
00228 
00229   /**** wait until receiver ready (CTS and DSR high) or XON received ****/
00230 
00231    retry = 0;
00232    do {
00233       if ((ccb[port].com_mode == 1 && (inportb(ccb[port].port_base + 6) & 0x30) != 0)
00234           || (ccb[port].com_mode == 2 && ccb[port].send_enable)
00235           || (ccb[port].com_mode == 0))
00236          break;
00237       retry++;
00238       sleep(1);
00239               /**** wait maximal retry_max sec. ****/
00240    } while ((retry < TIMEOUT));
00241 
00242    if (retry == TIMEOUT) {
00243       sprintf(str, "Timeout on COM%1d\n", port + 1);
00244       error(str);
00245    }
00246 
00247    outportb(ccb[port].port_base, c);         /**** send char ****/
00248 }
00249 
00250 void rs232_puts(RS232_INFO * info, char *str)
00251 {
00252    while (*str)
00253       computc(info->fd, *(str++));
00254 
00255    if (debug_flag) {
00256       FILE *f;
00257 
00258       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00259       fprintf(f, "puts: %s\n", str);
00260       fclose(f);
00261    }
00262 }
00263 
00264 /* -------------------------- get string --------------------------- */
00265 
00266 int rs232_gets(int port, char *s, int size, int end_char)
00267 {
00268 /*********************************************************************
00269 * Copies the ringbuffer into the string s. Return the number of valid*
00270 * chars in the string.                                               *
00271 * end_char == 0 : copy the whole buffer                              *
00272 * end_char != 0 : copy until "char" encountered                      *
00273 *********************************************************************/
00274    int temp_write_mark, i = 0, eos;
00275    char str[30];
00276 
00277    port--;
00278 
00279    if (ccb[port].com_error > 0) {
00280       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x01) == 0x01)
00281          sprintf(str, "COM%1d: Ringbuffer overflow\n", port + 1);
00282       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x04) == 0x04)
00283          sprintf(str, "COM%1d: Parity error\n", port + 1);
00284       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x08) == 0x08)
00285          sprintf(str, "COM%1d: Missing stop-bit\n", port + 1);
00286       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x10) == 0x10)
00287          sprintf(str, "COM%1d: Framing error\n", port + 1);
00288       error(str);
00289       ccb[port].com_error = 0;/**** reset error flag ****/
00290    }
00291 
00292    temp_write_mark = ccb[port].write_mark;
00293    if (temp_write_mark != ccb[port].read_mark) {
00294       temp_write_mark--;
00295       if (temp_write_mark < ccb[port].read_mark)
00296          temp_write_mark += RING_BUFF_LEN;
00297 
00298       /* if at least ten bytes room in the buffer, set DTR high / send XON */
00299       if (temp_write_mark - ccb[port].read_mark < RING_BUFF_LEN - 12) {
00300          if (ccb[port].com_mode == 2)
00301             computc(port, XON);
00302          if (ccb[port].com_mode == 1)
00303             outportb(ccb[port].port_base + 4, 9);
00304       }
00305 
00306       if (end_char == 0) {
00307          for (i = 0; (i <= temp_write_mark - ccb[port].read_mark) && (i < size - 1); i++)
00308             s[i] = ccb[port].ring_buff[(i + ccb[port].read_mark) % RING_BUFF_LEN];
00309          ccb[port].read_mark = (ccb[port].read_mark + i) % RING_BUFF_LEN;
00310       } else {
00311          eos = -1;
00312          for (i = 0; (i <= temp_write_mark - ccb[port].read_mark) && (i < size - 1); i++)
00313             if (ccb[port].ring_buff[(i + ccb[port].read_mark) % RING_BUFF_LEN]
00314                 == end_char) {
00315                eos = i;
00316                break;
00317             }
00318          if (eos >= 0)
00319             for (i = 0; i <= eos; i++)
00320                s[i] = ccb[port].ring_buff[(i + ccb[port].read_mark) % RING_BUFF_LEN];
00321          ccb[port].read_mark = (ccb[port].read_mark + i) % RING_BUFF_LEN;
00322       }
00323    }
00324    s[i] = 0;
00325 
00326    if (debug_flag) {
00327       FILE *f;
00328 
00329       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00330       fprintf(f, "gets: %s\n", s);
00331       fclose(f);
00332    }
00333 
00334    return (i);
00335 }
00336 
00337 /* ----------------------- wait for a string ----------------------- */
00338 
00339 int rs232_waitfor(int port, char *str, char *retstr, int size, int seconds)
00340 {
00341 /*********************************************************************
00342 * Wait for a specific string. Timeout after "seconds". Does NOT re-  *
00343 * move the string from the ringbuffer.                               *
00344 *********************************************************************/
00345    int temp_write_mark, i, j, k;
00346    char errstr[80];
00347    struct timeb start_time, act_time;
00348 
00349    port--;
00350    if (ccb[port].com_error > 0) {
00351       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x01) == 0x01)
00352          sprintf(errstr, "COM%1d: Ringbuffer overflow\n", port + 1);
00353       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x04) == 0x04)
00354          sprintf(errstr, "COM%1d: Parity error\n", port + 1);
00355       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x08) == 0x08)
00356          sprintf(errstr, "COM%1d: Missing stop-bit\n", port + 1);
00357       if ((ccb[port].com_error & 0x10) == 0x10)
00358          sprintf(errstr, "COM%1d: Framing error\n", port + 1);
00359       error(errstr);
00360       ccb[port].com_error = 0;/**** reset error flag ****/
00361    }
00362 
00363    ftime(&start_time);
00364 
00365    do {
00366       temp_write_mark = ccb[port].write_mark;
00367       if (temp_write_mark != ccb[port].read_mark) {
00368          temp_write_mark--;
00369          if (temp_write_mark < ccb[port].read_mark)
00370             temp_write_mark += RING_BUFF_LEN;
00371 
00372          /* if at least ten bytes room in the buffer, set DTR high / send XON */
00373          if (temp_write_mark - ccb[port].read_mark < RING_BUFF_LEN - 12) {
00374             if (ccb[port].com_mode == 2)
00375                computc(port, XON);
00376             if (ccb[port].com_mode == 1)
00377                outportb(ccb[port].port_base + 4, 9);
00378          }
00379 
00380          if (temp_write_mark - ccb[port].read_mark + 1 >= strlen(str)) {
00381             for (i = 0; i <= temp_write_mark - ccb[port].read_mark - strlen(str) + 1; i++) {
00382                if (str[0] ==
00383                    ccb[port].ring_buff[(i + ccb[port].read_mark) % RING_BUFF_LEN]) {
00384                   for (j = 1; j < strlen(str); j++)
00385                      if (str[j] !=
00386                          ccb[port].ring_buff[(i + j + ccb[port].read_mark) %
00387                                              RING_BUFF_LEN])
00388                         break;
00389                   if (j == strlen(str)) {
00390                      for (k = 0; k <= i + j - 1 && k < size - 1; k++)
00391                         retstr[k] =
00392                             ccb[port].ring_buff[(k + ccb[port].read_mark) %
00393                                                 RING_BUFF_LEN];
00394                      ccb[port].read_mark = (ccb[port].read_mark + k) % RING_BUFF_LEN;
00395                      retstr[k] = 0;
00396 
00397                      if (debug_flag) {
00398                         FILE *f;
00399 
00400                         f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00401                         fprintf(f, "waitfor: %s\n", retstr);
00402                         fclose(f);
00403                      }
00404 
00405                      return (k);
00406                   }
00407                }
00408             }
00409          }
00410       }
00411       ftime(&act_time);
00412    } while ((double) act_time.time + act_time.millitm / 1000 -
00413             start_time.time - start_time.millitm / 1000 < seconds);
00414 
00415    sprintf(errstr, "Timeout WAITFOR (%s)", str);
00416    error(errstr);
00417 
00418    retstr[0] = 0;
00419    return (0);
00420 }
00421 
00422 /* -------------------------- Interrupt Handler -------------------------- */
00423 
00424 void interrupt com1int()
00425 {
00426    comint_handler(1);
00427 }
00428 
00429 void interrupt com2int()
00430 {
00431    comint_handler(2);
00432 }
00433 
00434 void comint_handler(int port)
00435 {
00436 /*********************************************************************
00437 * This is the seial interrupt handler. It is called when a char is   *
00438 * received or an serial error occured.                               *
00439 *********************************************************************/
00440    char c;
00441    unsigned char int_type;
00442    int old_write_mark;
00443 
00444    port--;
00445    while (((int_type = inportb(ccb[port].port_base + 2)) & 1) == 0)
00446   /**** as long as an interrupt is pending ****/
00447    {
00448       if (int_type == 6)        /* Receiver Line Status Error   */
00449          ccb[port].com_error = inportb(ccb[port].port_base + 5) & 0x1E;
00450 
00451       if (int_type == 4) {      /* Received Data available      */
00452          c = inportb(ccb[port].port_base);
00453          if (c == XON)
00454             ccb[port].send_enable = 1;
00455          else if (c == XOFF)
00456             ccb[port].send_enable = 0;
00457          else {
00458         /**** write received char into the ringbuffer ****/
00459             ccb[port].ring_buff[ccb[port].write_mark] = c;
00460 
00461             old_write_mark = ccb[port].write_mark;
00462 
00463             ccb[port].write_mark = (ccb[port].write_mark + 1) % RING_BUFF_LEN;
00464 
00465         /**** if ringbuffer is nearly full, set DTR low / send XOFF ****/
00466             if (((ccb[port].write_mark + 1) % RING_BUFF_LEN) == ccb[port].read_mark) {
00467                if (ccb[port].com_mode == 2)
00468                   computc(port, XOFF);
00469                else
00470                   outportb(ccb[port].port_base + 4, 8);
00471             }
00472 
00473         /**** if ringbuffer if full, shift endmark and set error ****/
00474             if (ccb[port].write_mark == ccb[port].read_mark) {
00475                ccb[port].com_error = 1;
00476                cprintf("old_write_mark: %d, write_mark: %d, read_mark: %d\n\r",
00477                        old_write_mark, ccb[port].write_mark, ccb[port].read_mark);
00478 
00479                ccb[port].read_mark = (ccb[port].read_mark + 1) % RING_BUFF_LEN;
00480             }
00481          }
00482       }
00483    }                            /* end-of-while */
00484 
00485    outportb(0x20, 0x20);        /* end of interrupt */
00486 }
00487 
00488 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
00489 
00490 /*---- Windows NT ------------------------------------------------------------*/
00491 
00492 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00493 
00494 #include <stdio.h>
00495 
00496 int rs232_open(char *port, int baud, char parity, int data_bit, int stop_bit,
00497                int flow_control)
00498 {
00499    char str[80];
00500    DCB dcb;
00501    HANDLE hDev;
00502    COMMTIMEOUTS CommTimeOuts;
00503 
00504    sprintf(str, "\\\\.\\%s", port);
00505 
00506    hDev = CreateFile(str, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0,      // exclusive access
00507                      NULL,      // no security attrs
00508                      OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL | 0, NULL);
00509 
00510    if (hDev == (HANDLE) - 1)
00511       return -1;
00512 
00513    GetCommState(hDev, &dcb);
00514 
00515    sprintf(str, "baud=%d parity=%c data=%d stop=%d", baud, parity, data_bit, stop_bit);
00516    BuildCommDCB(str, &dcb);
00517 
00518    if (flow_control == 1) {
00519       dcb.fOutX = dcb.fInX = FALSE;
00520       //dcb.fDtrControl = DTR_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE;
00521       //dcb.fRtsControl = RTS_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE;
00522       dcb.fOutxCtsFlow = dcb.fOutxDsrFlow = TRUE;
00523    } else if (flow_control == 2) {
00524       dcb.fOutX = dcb.fInX = TRUE;
00525       dcb.fOutxCtsFlow = dcb.fOutxDsrFlow = FALSE;
00526    } else {
00527       dcb.fOutX = dcb.fInX = FALSE;
00528       dcb.fOutxCtsFlow = dcb.fOutxDsrFlow = FALSE;
00529    }
00530 
00531    if (SetCommState(hDev, &dcb) == FALSE)
00532       return -1;
00533 
00534    SetupComm(hDev, 4096, 4096);
00535 
00536    CommTimeOuts.ReadIntervalTimeout = 0;
00537    CommTimeOuts.ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier = 0;
00538    CommTimeOuts.ReadTotalTimeoutConstant = 0;
00539    CommTimeOuts.WriteTotalTimeoutMultiplier = 0;
00540    CommTimeOuts.WriteTotalTimeoutConstant = 5000;
00541 
00542    SetCommTimeouts((HANDLE) hDev, &CommTimeOuts);
00543 
00544    return (INT) hDev;
00545 }
00546 
00547 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00548 
00549 INT rs232_exit(RS232_INFO * info)
00550 {
00551    EscapeCommFunction((HANDLE) info->fd, CLRDTR);
00552 
00553    PurgeComm((HANDLE) info->fd, PURGE_TXABORT | PURGE_RXABORT |
00554              PURGE_TXCLEAR | PURGE_RXCLEAR);
00555    CloseHandle((HANDLE) info->fd);
00556 
00557    return SUCCESS;
00558 }
00559 
00560 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00561 
00562 int rs232_write(RS232_INFO * info, char *data, int size)
00563 {
00564    DWORD written, i;
00565 
00566    if (debug_flag) {
00567       FILE *f;
00568 
00569       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00570       fprintf(f, "write: ");
00571       for (i = 0; (int) i < size; i++)
00572          fprintf(f, "%X ", data[i]);
00573       fprintf(f, "\n");
00574       fclose(f);
00575    }
00576 
00577    WriteFile((HANDLE) info->fd, data, size, &written, NULL);
00578    return written;
00579 }
00580 
00581 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00582 
00583 int rs232_read(RS232_INFO * info, char *data, int size, int timeout)
00584 {
00585    int status, i, l;
00586    COMMTIMEOUTS CommTimeOuts;
00587 
00588    GetCommTimeouts((HANDLE) info->fd, &CommTimeOuts);
00589 
00590    CommTimeOuts.ReadIntervalTimeout = 0;
00591    CommTimeOuts.ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier = 0;
00592    CommTimeOuts.ReadTotalTimeoutConstant = timeout;
00593 
00594    SetCommTimeouts((HANDLE) info->fd, &CommTimeOuts);
00595 
00596    memset(data, 0, size);
00597    for (l = 0; l < size; l++) {
00598       status = ReadFile((HANDLE) info->fd, data + l, 1, &i, NULL);
00599       if (!status || i == 0)
00600          break;
00601    }
00602 
00603    if (debug_flag && l > 0) {
00604       FILE *f;
00605 
00606       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00607       fprintf(f, "read: ");
00608       for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
00609          fprintf(f, "%X ", data[i]);
00610       fprintf(f, "\n");
00611       fclose(f);
00612    }
00613 
00614    return l;
00615 }
00616 
00617 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00618 
00619 int rs232_puts(RS232_INFO * info, char *str)
00620 {
00621    DWORD written;
00622 
00623    if (debug_flag) {
00624       FILE *f;
00625 
00626       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00627       fprintf(f, "puts: %s\n", str);
00628       fclose(f);
00629    }
00630 
00631    WriteFile((HANDLE) info->fd, str, strlen(str), &written, NULL);
00632    return written;
00633 }
00634 
00635 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00636 
00637 int rs232_gets(RS232_INFO * info, char *str, int size, char *pattern, int timeout)
00638 {
00639    int status, i, l;
00640    COMMTIMEOUTS CommTimeOuts;
00641 
00642    GetCommTimeouts((HANDLE) info->fd, &CommTimeOuts);
00643 
00644    CommTimeOuts.ReadIntervalTimeout = 0;
00645    CommTimeOuts.ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier = 0;
00646    CommTimeOuts.ReadTotalTimeoutConstant = timeout;
00647 
00648    SetCommTimeouts((HANDLE) info->fd, &CommTimeOuts);
00649 
00650    memset(str, 0, size);
00651    for (l = 0; l < size - 1; l++) {
00652       status = ReadFile((HANDLE) info->fd, str + l, 1, &i, NULL);
00653       if (!status || i == 0) {
00654          if (pattern && pattern[0])
00655             return 0;
00656          break;
00657       }
00658 
00659       if (pattern && pattern[0])
00660          if (strstr(str, pattern) != NULL)
00661             break;
00662    }
00663 
00664    if (debug_flag && l > 0) {
00665       FILE *f;
00666 
00667       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00668       fprintf(f, "gets %s: %s\n", pattern, str);
00669       fclose(f);
00670    }
00671 
00672    return l;
00673 }
00674 
00675 #endif
00676 
00677 /*---- Linux ----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00678 
00679 #ifdef OS_LINUX
00680 
00681 #include <stdio.h>
00682 #include <string.h>
00683 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00684 #include <sys/timeb.h>
00685 #include <fcntl.h>
00686 #include <termios.h>
00687 #include <unistd.h>
00688 #include <stdlib.h>
00689 #include <stdarg.h>
00690 
00691 int rs232_open(char *port, int baud, char parity, int data_bit, int stop_bit,
00692                int flow_control)
00693 {
00694    int fd, i;
00695    struct termios tio;
00696 
00697    struct {
00698       int speed;
00699       int code;
00700    } baud_table[] = {
00701       {
00702       300, B300}, {
00703       600, B600}, {
00704       1200, B1200}, {
00705       1800, B1800}, {
00706       2400, B2400}, {
00707       4800, B4800}, {
00708       9600, B9600}, {
00709       19200, B19200}, {
00710       38400, B38400}, {
00711       0, 0}
00712    };
00713 
00714 
00715    fd = open(port, O_RDWR);
00716    if (fd < 0) {
00717       perror("rs232_open");
00718       return fd;
00719    }
00720 
00721    tio.c_iflag = 0;
00722    tio.c_oflag = 0;
00723    tio.c_cflag = CREAD | CLOCAL;
00724    if (data_bit == 7)
00725       tio.c_cflag |= CS7;
00726    else
00727       tio.c_cflag |= CS8;
00728 
00729    if (stop_bit == 2)
00730       tio.c_cflag |= CSTOPB;
00731 
00732    if (parity == 'E')
00733       tio.c_cflag |= PARENB;
00734    if (parity == 'O')
00735       tio.c_cflag |= PARENB | PARODD;
00736 
00737    if (flow_control == 1)
00738       tio.c_cflag |= CRTSCTS;
00739    if (flow_control == 2)
00740       tio.c_iflag |= IXON | IXOFF;
00741 
00742    tio.c_lflag = 0;
00743    tio.c_cc[VMIN] = 1;
00744    tio.c_cc[VTIME] = 0;
00745 
00746    /* check baud argument */
00747    for (i = 0; baud_table[i].speed; i++) {
00748       if (baud == baud_table[i].speed)
00749          break;
00750    }
00751 
00752    if (!baud_table[i].speed)
00753       i = 6;                    /* 9600 baud by default */
00754 
00755    cfsetispeed(&tio, baud_table[i].code);
00756    cfsetospeed(&tio, baud_table[i].code);
00757 
00758    tcsetattr(fd, TCSANOW, &tio);
00759 
00760    return fd;
00761 }
00762 
00763 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00764 
00765 int rs232_exit(RS232_INFO * info)
00766 {
00767    close(info->fd);
00768 
00769    return SUCCESS;
00770 }
00771 
00772 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00773 
00774 int rs232_write(RS232_INFO * info, char *data, int size)
00775 {
00776    int i;
00777 
00778    if (debug_flag) {
00779       FILE *f;
00780 
00781       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00782       fprintf(f, "write: ");
00783       for (i = 0; (int) i < size; i++)
00784          fprintf(f, "%X ", data[i]);
00785       fprintf(f, "\n");
00786       fclose(f);
00787    }
00788 
00789    i = write(info->fd, data, size);
00790 
00791    return i;
00792 }
00793 
00794 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00795 
00796 int rs232_read(RS232_INFO * info, char *str, int size, int timeout)
00797 {
00798    int i, l;
00799    struct timeb start, now;
00800    double fstart, fnow;
00801 
00802    ftime(&start);
00803    fstart = start.time + start.millitm / 1000.0;
00804 
00805    memset(str, 0, size);
00806    for (l = 0; l < size - 1;) {
00807       ioctl(info->fd, FIONREAD, &i);
00808       if (i > 0) {
00809          i = read(info->fd, str + l, 1);
00810 
00811          if (i == 1)
00812             l++;
00813          else
00814             perror("read");
00815       }
00816 
00817       ftime(&now);
00818       fnow = now.time + now.millitm / 1000.0;
00819 
00820       if (fnow - fstart >= timeout / 1000.0)
00821          break;
00822 
00823       if (i == 0)
00824          usleep(MIN(100000, timeout * 1000));
00825    }
00826 
00827    if (debug_flag && l > 0) {
00828       FILE *f;
00829 
00830       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00831       fprintf(f, "read: ");
00832       for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
00833          fprintf(f, "%X ", str[i]);
00834       fprintf(f, "\n");
00835       fclose(f);
00836    }
00837 
00838    return l;
00839 }
00840 
00841 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00842 
00843 int rs232_puts(RS232_INFO * info, char *str)
00844 {
00845    int i;
00846 
00847    if (debug_flag) {
00848       FILE *f;
00849 
00850       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00851       fprintf(f, "puts: %s\n", str);
00852       fclose(f);
00853    }
00854 
00855    i = write(info->fd, str, strlen(str));
00856 
00857    return i;
00858 }
00859 
00860 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00861 
00862 int rs232_gets(RS232_INFO * info, char *str, int size, char *pattern, int timeout)
00863 {
00864    int i, l;
00865    struct timeb start, now;
00866    double fstart, fnow;
00867 
00868    ftime(&start);
00869    fstart = start.time + start.millitm / 1000.0;
00870 
00871    memset(str, 0, size);
00872    for (l = 0; l < size - 1;) {
00873       ioctl(info->fd, FIONREAD, &i);
00874       if (i > 0) {
00875          i = read(info->fd, str + l, 1);
00876 
00877          if (i == 1)
00878             l++;
00879          else
00880             perror("read");
00881       }
00882 
00883       if (pattern && pattern[0])
00884          if (strstr(str, pattern) != NULL)
00885             break;
00886 
00887       ftime(&now);
00888       fnow = now.time + now.millitm / 1000.0;
00889 
00890       if (fnow - fstart >= timeout / 1000.0) {
00891          if (pattern && pattern[0])
00892             return 0;
00893          break;
00894       }
00895 
00896       if (i == 0)
00897          usleep(MIN(100000, timeout * 1000));
00898 
00899    };
00900 
00901    if (debug_flag && l > 0) {
00902       FILE *f;
00903 
00904       f = fopen("rs232.log", "a");
00905       fprintf(f, "getstr %s: %s\n", pattern, str);
00906       fclose(f);
00907    }
00908 
00909    return l;
00910 }
00911 
00912 #endif
00913 
00914 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00915 
00916 int rs232_init(HNDLE hkey, void **pinfo)
00917 {
00918    HNDLE hDB, hkeybd;
00919    INT size, status;
00920    RS232_INFO *info;
00921 
00922    /* allocate info structure */
00923    info = calloc(1, sizeof(RS232_INFO));
00924    *pinfo = info;
00925 
00926    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00927 
00928    /* create RS232 settings record */
00929    status = db_create_record(hDB, hkey, "BD", RS232_SETTINGS_STR);
00930    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
00931       return FE_ERR_ODB;
00932 
00933    db_find_key(hDB, hkey, "BD", &hkeybd);
00934    size = sizeof(info->settings);
00935    db_get_record(hDB, hkeybd, &info->settings, &size, 0);
00936 
00937    /* open port */
00938    info->fd = rs232_open(info->settings.port,
00939                          info->settings.baud, info->settings.parity,
00940                          info->settings.data_bit, info->settings.stop_bit,
00941                          info->settings.flow_control);
00942 
00943    if (info->fd < 0)
00944       return FE_ERR_HW;
00945 
00946    return SUCCESS;
00947 }
00948 
00949 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00950 
00951 INT rs232(INT cmd, ...)
00952 {
00953    va_list argptr;
00954    HNDLE hkey;
00955    INT status, size, timeout;
00956    void *info;
00957    char *str, *pattern;
00958 
00959    va_start(argptr, cmd);
00960    status = FE_SUCCESS;
00961 
00962    switch (cmd) {
00963    case CMD_INIT:
00964       hkey = va_arg(argptr, HNDLE);
00965       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00966       status = rs232_init(hkey, info);
00967       break;
00968 
00969    case CMD_EXIT:
00970       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00971       status = rs232_exit(info);
00972       break;
00973 
00974    case CMD_NAME:
00975       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00976       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00977       strcpy(str, "rs232");
00978       break;
00979 
00980    case CMD_WRITE:
00981       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00982       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00983       size = va_arg(argptr, int);
00984       status = rs232_write(info, str, size);
00985       break;
00986 
00987    case CMD_READ:
00988       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00989       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00990       size = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00991       timeout = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00992       status = rs232_read(info, str, size, timeout);
00993       break;
00994 
00995    case CMD_PUTS:
00996       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00997       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00998       status = rs232_puts(info, str);
00999       break;
01000 
01001    case CMD_GETS:
01002       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
01003       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
01004       size = va_arg(argptr, INT);
01005       pattern = va_arg(argptr, char *);
01006       timeout = va_arg(argptr, INT);
01007       status = rs232_gets(info, str, size, pattern, timeout);
01008       break;
01009 
01010    case CMD_DEBUG:
01011       status = va_arg(argptr, INT);
01012       debug_flag = status;
01013       break;
01014    }
01015 
01016    va_end(argptr);
01017 
01018    return status;
01019 }
